Digital goods

Digital Goods API is mainly focused on selling In-game virtual items, services and premium membership with PayAlto.

Stored Widget Call

It shows a widget, where stored products in Products section of Merchant Acoount are available for payment. Both subscription and one-time payment are supported in out products section

Parameter:

Name Required Format Description
key yes String(32 Sample: 24849849491651
Can be found in General Settings of
the Project inside of your Merchant
Account
uld yes String(64) Sample: test@paymentwall.com
Not case-sensitive
ID of the end-user in your system
(usually it is an email) who is viewing
the widget.The maximum length is 64.
widget yes String Sample: p1_1
Widget code.Can be obtained by
Merchant Account -> Projects->
Widgets
email yes String Sample: test@paymentwall.com
Paymentwall wil automatically send a
payment receipt to the end-user
timestamp yes String(10) Sample: 1477985778
Unix timestamp of the current date
sign_version no String Sample: 2,3
Signature Version.
sign no String Sample: 7633c3b060fa2ddd41283ff
d4629ab40
Refer to Signature Calculation

Result:

You will get a URL of iframe by widget object

plan
string		 Identifies the product ID, send back as goodsid parameter in
pinbacks.eg:productax123
period
required
string		 day/week/month/year
period_duration
required
string		 Number of peroids mentioned the period parameter. By default
minimum duration for reccuring in 3 days. This can be adjusted
by contacting devsupport@payentwall.com
Javascript
Java
PHP
.Net
Python
Library:
https://github.com/paymentwall/paymentwall-java
Request URL
https://api.com/paymentwall.com/api/subscription
Request method
https://api.com/paymentwall.com/api/subscription
Initialize
          
    import com.paymentwall.java.Base;
        
            Base.setAppKey("YOUR_APPLICATION_CODE");
            Base.setECURITYKey("YOUR_SECRET_KEY");
            Base.setApiType("Base.API_GOODS");
Stored Widget Call
            
    import com.paymentwall.java.Widget;
    import .com.paymentwall.java.WidgetBuilder;
    import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
        
          WidgetBuilder widgetBuilder = new WidgetBuilder
          (userid, widgetcode);
        
          widgetBuilder.setExtraParams(new LinkedHashMap
          <String, String>(){
              {
                put("email", email);
                put("timestamp", email);
              }
            });
        
            Widget widget = widgetBuilder.build();
Result Example
            
      WidgetgetHtmlCode();
              
            
      <iframe src="https://api.paymentwall.com/api/rest/product/" 
      width="750"frameborder="0" height="800"<>/iframe>
